<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195" lineLink="#a9a38951dfaf8914d13e5398459f43204"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::optional&lt;PPC::Predicate&gt; <a href="#a9a38951dfaf8914d13e5398459f43204">getComparePred</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78b">CmpInst::Predicate</a> Pred) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">switch</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Pred) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// These are not representable with any single compare.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78bae9c013750fff3023001d7e3af8df2d6d">CmpInst::FCMP&#95;FALSE</a>:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba0a33c71e3c5e8f128ca47539a85962f5">CmpInst::FCMP&#95;TRUE</a>:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Major concern about the following 6 cases is NaN result. The comparison</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// result consists of 4 bits, indicating lt, eq, gt and un (unordered),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// only one of which will be set. The result is generated by fcmpu</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instruction. However, bc instruction only inspects one of the first 3</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// bits, so when un is set, bc instruction may jump to an undesired</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// place.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// More specifically, if we expect an unordered comparison and un is set, we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// expect to always go to true branch; in such case UEQ, UGT and ULT still</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// give false, which are undesired; but UNE, UGE, ULE happen to give true,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// since they are tested by inspecting !eq, !lt, !gt, respectively.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Similarly, for ordered comparison, when un is set, we always expect the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// result to be false. In such case OGT, OLT and OEQ is good, since they are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// actually testing GT, LT, and EQ respectively, which are false. OGE, OLE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and ONE are tested through !lt, !gt and !eq, and these are true.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba919643b83ce3c9af2e4296ed5e413a1f">CmpInst::FCMP&#95;UEQ</a>:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba959268ceeae23abe5c9ad9e895669d0c">CmpInst::FCMP&#95;UGT</a>:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba75016d5872d90adf89cc1cbf5763f474">CmpInst::FCMP&#95;ULT</a>:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba541533f34077bbbcfb703a90f6d2da9b">CmpInst::FCMP&#95;OGE</a>:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba9835cfe02fb5027680bd7203b024f77a">CmpInst::FCMP&#95;OLE</a>:</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00449" /><CodeLine lineNumber="449"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="450"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If ResultReg is given, it determines the register class of the load.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="451"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Otherwise, RC is the register class to use.  If the result of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00452" /><CodeLine lineNumber="452"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// load isn&#39;t anticipated in this block, both may be zero, in which</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="453"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// case we must make a conservative guess.  In particular, don&#39;t assign</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="454"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// R0 or X0 to the result register, as the result may be used in a load,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="455"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// store, add-immediate, or isel that won&#39;t permit this.  (Though</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="456"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// perhaps the spill and reload of live-exit values would handle this?)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="457"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterclass">TargetRegisterClass</a> &#42;UseRC =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00458" /><CodeLine lineNumber="458"><span class="doxyHighlight">    (ResultReg ? <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64advsimdscalarpass-cpp/#aacd2ab195054a3e6a74bfbb9d5d571c8">MRI</a>.getRegClass(ResultReg) :</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="459"><span class="doxyHighlight">     (RC ? RC :</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00460" /><CodeLine lineNumber="460"><span class="doxyHighlight">      (VT == MVT::f64 ? (HasSPE ? &amp;PPC::SPERCRegClass : &amp;PPC::F8RCRegClass) :</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00461" /><CodeLine lineNumber="461"><span class="doxyHighlight">       (VT == MVT::f32 ? (HasSPE ? &amp;PPC::GPRCRegClass : &amp;PPC::F4RCRegClass) :</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00462" /><CodeLine lineNumber="462"><span class="doxyHighlight">        (VT == MVT::i64 ? &amp;PPC::G8RC&#95;and&#95;G8RC&#95;NOX0RegClass :</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00463" /><CodeLine lineNumber="463"><span class="doxyHighlight">         &amp;PPC::GPRC&#95;and&#95;GPRC&#95;NOR0RegClass)))));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00464" /><CodeLine lineNumber="464"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00465" /><CodeLine lineNumber="465"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Is32BitInt = UseRC-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterclass/#abee1c3236731101b249f6eeffd8cd7ba">hasSuperClassEq</a>(&amp;PPC::GPRCRegClass);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00466" /><CodeLine lineNumber="466"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00467" /><CodeLine lineNumber="467"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">switch</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (VT.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mvt/#a27bda7d8e8e4f0337650a892f3c9b46a">SimpleTy</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00468" /><CodeLine lineNumber="468"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">default</span><span class="doxyHighlight">: </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// e.g., vector types not handled</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00469" /><CodeLine lineNumber="469"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00470" /><CodeLine lineNumber="470"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MVT::i8:</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00472" /><CodeLine lineNumber="472"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00473" /><CodeLine lineNumber="473"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MVT::i16:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00474" /><CodeLine lineNumber="474"><span class="doxyHighlight">      Opc = (IsZExt ? (Is32BitInt ? PPC::LHZ : PPC::LHZ8)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00476" /><CodeLine lineNumber="476"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00477" /><CodeLine lineNumber="477"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MVT::i32:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00478" /><CodeLine lineNumber="478"><span class="doxyHighlight">      Opc = (IsZExt ? (Is32BitInt ? PPC::LWZ : PPC::LWZ8)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="479"><span class="doxyHighlight">                    : (Is32BitInt ? PPC::LWA&#95;32 : PPC::LWA));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="480"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ((Opc == PPC::LWA || Opc == PPC::LWA&#95;32) &amp;&amp; ((Addr.Offset &amp; 3) != 0))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="481"><span class="doxyHighlight">        UseOffset = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="482"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="483"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MVT::i64:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="484"><span class="doxyHighlight">      Opc = PPC::LD;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="485"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(UseRC-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterclass/#abee1c3236731101b249f6eeffd8cd7ba">hasSuperClassEq</a>(&amp;PPC::G8RCRegClass) &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="497"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If necessary, materialize the offset into a register and use</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="498"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the indexed form.  Also handle stack pointers with special needs.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="502"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If this is a potential VSX load with an offset of 0, a VSX indexed load can</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00567" /><CodeLine lineNumber="567"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00568" /><CodeLine lineNumber="568"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If we have an index register defined we use it in the store inst,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00569" /><CodeLine lineNumber="569"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// otherwise we use X0 as base as it makes the vector instructions to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00570" /><CodeLine lineNumber="570"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// use zero in the computation of the effective address regardless the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="571"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// content of the register.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="572"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (IndexReg)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="573"><span class="doxyHighlight">      MIB.addReg(Addr.Base.Reg).addReg(IndexReg);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00574" /><CodeLine lineNumber="574"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="575"><span class="doxyHighlight">      MIB.addReg(PPC::ZERO8).addReg(Addr.Base.Reg);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="576"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="577"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="578"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="579"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="580"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="581"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Attempt to fast-select a load instruction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="582"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> PPCFastISel::SelectLoad(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="583"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FIXME: No atomic loads are supported.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="584"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac4fc845f5ed92de63cd4474f128f5fc5">cast&lt;LoadInst&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>)-&gt;isAtomic())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="585"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="586"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="587"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Verify we have a legal type before going any further.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="588"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mvt">MVT</a> VT;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="589"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!isLoadTypeLegal(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>-&gt;getType(), VT))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="590"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="591"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="592"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See if we can handle this address.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="596"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="597"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Look at the currently assigned register for this instruction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="598"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to determine the required register class.  This is necessary</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1005"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Move an i32 or i64 value in a GPR to an f64 value in an FPR.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1118"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1402"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1403"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The prolog code of the callee may store up to 8 GPR argument registers to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1404"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the stack, allowing va&#95;start to index over them in memory if its varargs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1405"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Because we cannot tell if this is needed on the caller side, we have to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1406"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// conservatively assume that it is needed.  As such, make sure we have at</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1407"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// least enough stack space for the caller to store the 8 GPRs.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2046"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Materialize the address of a global value into a register, and return</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2047"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the register number (or zero if we failed to handle it).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2048"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> PPCFastISel::PPCMaterializeGV(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue">GlobalValue</a> &#42;GV, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mvt">MVT</a> VT) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2049"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If this is a PC-Rel function, let SDISel handle GV materialization.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2050"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Subtarget-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ppcsubtarget/#a6a2a00931f022fa78f6cdadb07e6d775">isUsingPCRelativeCalls</a>())</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2056"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2057"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Global values may be plain old object addresses, TLS object</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2058"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// addresses, constant pool entries, or jump tables.  How we generate</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2059"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// code for these may depend on small, medium, or large code model.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2060"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/codemodel/#afc59396a9e5809fc92938e203d91a8df">CodeModel::Model</a> CModel = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/systemzisd/#a24fe7decb4ebdd8b4c7a774d65fcaa7ea68ace50a32835aa0562cf8f9694ba510">TM</a>.getCodeModel();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2061"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2062"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FIXME: Jump tables are not yet required because fast-isel doesn&#39;t</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2063"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// handle switches; if that changes, we need them as well.  For now,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2368"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2369"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2370"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Attempt to lower call arguments in a faster way than done by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2371"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the selection DAG code.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2372"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fastisel/#a9b32a3c62f5c8ad8f9b9610cc3e5707c">PPCFastISel::fastLowerArguments</a>() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2373"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Defer to normal argument lowering for now.  It&#39;s reasonably</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2374"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// efficient.  Consider doing something like ARM to handle the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2375"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// case where all args fit in registers, no varargs, no float</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2376"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// or vector args.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2377"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2378"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2379"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2380"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Handle materializing integer constants into a register.  This is not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2381"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// automatically generated for PowerPC, so must be explicitly created here.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02382" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2382"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> PPCFastISel::fastEmit&#95;i(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mvt">MVT</a> Ty, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mvt">MVT</a> VT, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Opc, uint64&#95;t Imm) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2383"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2384"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Opc != <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110aac2f0a84dd2aa5ee4c3f1385e9565f5e">ISD::Constant</a>)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2385"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2386"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2387"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If we&#39;re using CR bit registers for i1 values, handle that as a special</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2388"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// case first.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2389"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (VT == MVT::i1 &amp;&amp; Subtarget-&gt;useCRBits()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2390"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> ImmReg = createResultReg(&amp;PPC::CRBITRCRegClass);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2391"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a17e04afcf0c5efeb0eb6a9a45287b5e4">BuildMI</a>(&#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-memprofcontextdisambiguation-cpp-/#ab7b317804874313a6eaa944cc003698c">FuncInfo</a>.MBB, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-memprofcontextdisambiguation-cpp-/#ab7b317804874313a6eaa944cc003698c">FuncInfo</a>.InsertPt, MIMD,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2392"><span class="doxyHighlight">            <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagoncopytocombine-cpp/#a1d40004718218dbdf06b496766299101">TII</a>.get(Imm == 0 ? PPC::CRUNSET : PPC::CRSET), ImmReg);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2393"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ImmReg;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2394"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2395"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2396"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (VT != MVT::i64 &amp;&amp; VT != MVT::i32 &amp;&amp; VT != MVT::i16 &amp;&amp; VT != MVT::i8 &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2398"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> 0;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2400"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterclass">TargetRegisterClass</a> &#42;RC = ((VT == MVT::i64) ? &amp;PPC::G8RCRegClass :</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2404"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2405"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> PPCMaterialize32BitInt(Imm, RC);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2406"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2407"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2408"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Override for ADDI and ADDI8 to set the correct register class</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2409"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// on RHS operand 0  The automatic infrastructure naively assumes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2410"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// GPRC for i32 and G8RC for i64; the concept of &quot;no R0&quot; is lost</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2411"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for these cases.  At the moment, none of the other automatically</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2412"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// generated RI instructions require special treatment.  However, once</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2413"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SelectSelect is implemented, &quot;isel&quot; requires similar handling.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2414"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2415"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Also be conservative about the output register class.  Avoid</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2416"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// assigning R0 or X0 to the output register for GPRC and G8RC</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2417"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// register classes, as any such result could be used in ADDI, etc.,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2418"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// where those regs have another meaning.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2419"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> PPCFastISel::fastEmitInst&#95;ri(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MachineInstOpcode,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2420"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterclass">TargetRegisterClass</a> &#42;RC,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2421"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Op0,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2422"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                      uint64&#95;t Imm) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2423"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (MachineInstOpcode == PPC::ADDI)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2424"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64advsimdscalarpass-cpp/#aacd2ab195054a3e6a74bfbb9d5d571c8">MRI</a>.setRegClass(Op0, &amp;PPC::GPRC&#95;and&#95;GPRC&#95;NOR0RegClass);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2425"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (MachineInstOpcode == PPC::ADDI8)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2426"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64advsimdscalarpass-cpp/#aacd2ab195054a3e6a74bfbb9d5d571c8">MRI</a>.setRegClass(Op0, &amp;PPC::G8RC&#95;and&#95;G8RC&#95;NOX0RegClass);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2427"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2428"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterclass">TargetRegisterClass</a> &#42;UseRC =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2429"><span class="doxyHighlight">    (RC == &amp;PPC::GPRCRegClass ? &amp;PPC::GPRC&#95;and&#95;GPRC&#95;NOR0RegClass :</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2430"><span class="doxyHighlight">     (RC == &amp;PPC::G8RCRegClass ? &amp;PPC::G8RC&#95;and&#95;G8RC&#95;NOX0RegClass : RC));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2431"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2432"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fastisel/#aef1cb331526de21d6b1729a42a72d74f">FastISel::fastEmitInst&#95;ri</a>(MachineInstOpcode, UseRC, Op0, Imm);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2433"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2435"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Override for instructions with one register operand to avoid use of</span></CodeLine>
